lines.text: False Negatives

spans.text: False Negatives

lines.text: A false negative occurs when no drought impact is predicted but drought conditions occur.

spans.text: A false negative occurs when no drought impact is predicted but drought conditions occur.

lines.text: The team could consider additional mitigation strategies such as the use of citizen science or

spans.text: The team could consider additional mitigation strategies such as the use of citizen science or

lines.text: Insufficient Data

spans.text: Insufficient Data

lines.text: Insufficient data refers to the gaps in impact data used to verify the forecast predictions.

spans.text: Insufficient data refers to the gaps in impact data used to verify the forecast predictions.

lines.text: Insufficient data might limit the precise prediction of forecasted humanitarian impact and

spans.text: Insufficient data might limit the precise prediction of forecasted humanitarian impact and

lines.text: expose local populations to adverse humanitarian impact induced by a drought event, requiring

spans.text: expose local populations to adverse humanitarian impact induced by a drought event, requiring

lines.text: a large-scale humanitarian response ex-post. The team should consider the feasibility of adding

spans.text: a large-scale humanitarian response ex-post. The team should consider the feasibility of adding

lines.text: further vulnerability layers in future iterations of the model.

spans.text: further vulnerability layers in future iterations of the model.

lines.text: False Positives

spans.text: False Positives

lines.text: A false positive happens when drought impact is predicted but no drought conditions occur.

spans.text: A false positive happens when drought impact is predicted but no drought conditions occur.

lines.text: Anticipatory action follows the ‘no regret’ principle, but a false alarm can still lead to inadequate
